description.p: Monks of the Way of Steel strive to imitate the strength, flexibility, and refinability of steel. Through rigorous training, they hardening their bodies to be like the plates of armour, and their fists like the head of a warhammer.

description.p: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, your body's ability to take hits has been boosted. As a reaction you can spend a ki point ot add 3 to your ac.

description.p: At 6th level, you've mastered techniques to harden your body in just the right ways, allowing your fists to strike like a sledgehammer. As a bonus action you can expend 2 kip points to add 1d8 bludgeoning damage to all of your melee attacks for the next minute.

description.p: At 11th level, your body has taken on the ever-improving nature of steel. You are resistant to fire and cold damage. Additionally, if you use your Fists of Steel feature the turn after you've taken fire or cold damage, you can deal 1d6 of that type in addition.

description.p: At 17th level, your body is like a suit of armour. When you are reduced to 0 hit points you can expend 3 ki points to be reduced to 1 hit point instead.
